intro: Riedlea cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban riedlea, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, palmate leaves, and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
